title: Kung Pao Chicken
description: A classic Kung Pao Chicken with spicy, tangy flavors, featuring marinated chicken stir-fried with zucchini, aromatics, chili, and roasted peanuts.
overview: A spicy, tangy Kung Pao Chicken with roasted peanuts and vibrant vegetables.

ingredients.title: Chicken & Marinade
content: 450 g chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces

stages.title: Step 1
content: Prepare aromatics: Mince 4 cloves of garlic, mince 5 slices of ginger, chop 4 stalks of green onion, and cut the zucchini into large dice-sized pieces.

stages.title: Step 2
content: Marinate the chicken: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and combine with soy sauce, sugar, white pepper powder, corn starch, baking soda, rice wine, and water. Mix well, then add oil.

stages.title: Step 3
content: Stir fry the zucchini: Heat some oil in a pan over medium heat. Add zucchini and toss them. Season with 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp sugar, then add rice wine and cook until the wine cooks off. Remove the zucchini and set aside.

stages.title: Step 4
content: Stir fry the chicken: If needed, add oil to the pan. Saut√© the minced garlic, ginger, and chopped green onion until fragrant (about 10-20 seconds), then add 1 tsp chili flakes and the dried whole chilies. Add the marinated chicken and spread it out until golden on the bottom. Stir fry until the chicken is about half-cooked. Add 1 tbsp rice wine and continue cooking until the wine cooks off. Then add 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp dark soy sauce, 1 1/2 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp paprika, and 1 tbsp rice vinegar. Stir fry until the color is even, then add 3/4 cup water.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Finish: When the sauce starts to thicken, add the reserved zucchini, 1/4 tsp white pepper powder, and 1/2 cup roasted peanuts. Toss everything together until well combined.
